intro: Canthium nitidum var. suboblique, commonly known as the narrow-angled canthium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and stamens that are prominently displayed. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, aiding in its dispersal in natural habitats.
